definitions.definition: One who, or that which, accelerates .
examples: The Second World War is said to have been a great accelerator for many scientific findings.

definitions.definition: A substance which speeds up chemical reactions.
A pedal causing the vehicle to accelerate when it is pressed.
examples: As soon as you get onto the slipway, push the accelerator .

definitions.definition: A chemical that reduces development time.
A device that accelerates charged subatomic particles ; a particle accelerator .
A muscle or nerve that speeds the performance of an action.
A computer component using dedicated hardware to accelerate the processing and display of graphics.
A light van to take mails between a post office and a railway station .
A mentoring program for startup companies.

main_definition: One who, or that which, accelerates .
secondary_definitions: ( chemistry ) A substance which speeds up chemical reactions.
( vehicles ) A pedal causing the vehicle to accelerate when it is pressed.
( photography ) A chemical that reduces development time.
( physics ) A device that accelerates charged subatomic particles ; a particle accelerator .
( physiology , medicine ) A muscle or nerve that speeds the performance of an action.
( computing ) A computer component using dedicated hardware to accelerate the processing and display of graphics.
( historical ) A light van to take mails between a post office and a railway station .
( business ) A mentoring program for startup companies.
